item.title: Rutein May Be Effective in Combating Osteoarthritis
item.description: Rutein (rutin), a flavonoid found in certain fruits and vegetables, may be effective in combating osteoarthritis, according to a recent study conducted at Baylor College of Medicine. Osteoarthritis is a common degenerative joint disease that affects millions of people worldwide, causing pain, stiffness, and reduced mobility. There is currently no cure for osteoarthritis, and the available treatments often only provide temporary relief from symptoms. Researchers at Baylor College of Medicine set out to investigate the potential benefits of rutein in treating osteoarthritis.
